q: Page can take over the reins. Eric Schmidt , previously CEO of Novell and CTO of Sun Microsystems, has by far the most enterprise experience in the triumvirate that runs Google, which also includes co-founder Sergey Brin . Eric Schmidt clearly had passion for enterprise software, says Gartner analyst Whit Andrews.`` He cared about enterprise software. He worked at a lot of companies that sold enterprise software and bunch of enterprise products. That history is not in place with Page.''

Reflecting on the Arizona shootings that killed six people and badly wounded Rep. Gabrielle Giffords , Colin Powell said he was dismayed by the harsh tenor of political debate that some have said may have contributed to the attack. There has crept in our society and our public dialogue, a coarseness, a nastiness, an attack of people who don't share the same views as you do, he said.`` All sorts of nastiness. Eric Schmidt did not hide his belief that Google should stay in the world's largest consumer marketplace,'' Ken Auletta writes. Eric Schmidt , according to associates, lost some energy and focus after losing the China decision. Even if you believe that Eric Schmidt 's`` adult subversion'' got the best out of Page and Sergey Brin , his success as CEO is somewhat limited. Google is often called a one-trick pony, with its

likely more going on than the public statements indicate.`` In terms of Google's financial performance, there should be no change. The company is firing on almost all cylinders,'' Sterling said. However, I'm not sure that Larry Will Page has the` polish' to be the company's public face at this challenging time. Given all the and political challenges Google faces, it remains to be seen how well he'll function as a spokesman for the company. Internally, employees might welcome the change with Will Page 's ascension as symbolic of a return to its roots.
